review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: If you took full responsibility for everything in your life yesterday, that put you
            on The Path.
quote: “You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.\" Mae West

step_of_the_day.title:
Notice how much you are guided by the fear of what can go wrong. How much do you live from a survival
            perspective? (Pillar #5)
step_of_the_day.content:
What’s your number one goal in life? Instinctually it’s to survive. You don’t have a say in the matter, the
            imperative is buried deep in the most primitive parts of your brain and nervous system. But this dominance
            can hold you back and can also get corrupted by lessons of childhood.These lessons get internalized and held by your internal parent, or what I’ve been referring to as the
            spokesperson of your Primitive Gestalt Pattern. This voice wants to protect you at all costs. But it judges
            this need to protect, based on an outmoded and typically negative set of judgments about you and your
            “lacks.\" When you have a more negative self-view, there is a greater need to protect. And a larger view of
            danger and what can go wrong.

action_step:
Today, notice how the above process plays itself out: fear of what can go wrong, fear of being exposed, as
            well as how you hold yourself back to avoid negative outcomes. And identify your negative self-judgements
            that drive this thinking.
